SEARCH

Class BST<T extends Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
BST<T>
Type Parameters:
T - generic format, yet specifically a string in this lab.
public class BST<T extends Comparable<T>> extends Object
The BST class implements a binary search tree. A binary search tree (BST) is a useful form of a binary tree. A BST has an ordering property where any node's left subtree keys ≤ the node's key, and the right subtree's keys ≥ the node's key, enables faster searching for an item.

  • Method Details

    • delete

      protected boolean delete(T item)
      Removes the first found matching node, restructuring the tree to preserve the BST ordering property. The algorithm first searches for a matching node and performs one of the following sub-algorithms: removing a leaf node, removing an internal node with single child, or removing an internal node with two children.
      Parameters:
      key - desired node to remove
      Returns:
      node not found

    • insert

      protected BST<T>.BST.BSTNode<T> insert(T data)
      Inserts the new node in a proper location according to the BST ordering property and will insert the new node accordingly to either the root, as a left child, or as a right child.
      Parameters:
      data - node to add.
      Returns:
      the new node.

    • insert

      protected BST<T>.BST.BSTNode<T> insert(T data, BST<T>.BST.BSTNode<T> pointer)

    • search

      protected BST<T>.BST.BSTNode<T> search(T item)
      Searches the tree by visiting the root node then continues to perform comparisons.
      Parameters:
      item - desired key to find.
      Returns:
      first node found matching the key or returns null if a node is not found.

    • search

      protected BST<T>.BST.BSTNode<T> search(T item, BST<T>.BST.BSTNode<T> root)

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
